description.narrative: Insatserna kommer att bidra till att förbättra miljöstyrningen i Bosnien och Hercegovina genom att skapa förutsättningar för miljömässiga CSOs och att allmänheten effektivt deltar i beslutsprocesserna i samband med miljökonsekvens bedömningar (EIA) och strategiska miljöbedömningar (SEA), men också att påverka nyckelreformerna för vidare införlivande och genomförande av EU: s miljölagstiftning.

Regional Environment Centre Country Office for BiH (REC CO BiH) has applied to Sida/Embassy for funding of 14,1 million SEK to carry out the project "Environmental Lobbing and Advocacy CSO Network”.
In recent years, Bosnia and Herzegovina has transposed majority of directives prescribing procedures for assessing impacts and requirements for evaluating impact. However, implementation of these requirements by relevant public institutions is at best pro forma, resulting in poor quality assessments, significant impacts on natural resources, non-transparent decision-making process usually devoid of civil society and public participation, and lack of ownership of those projects by the wider public and especially local communities. New environmental legislations/policies/programs/ planes are often being introduced without public participation and transparency. General public`s and CSOs’ contribution to the environmental policy and decision-making process in BiH is rather limited and civil dialogue is weak. All these results in overuse of natural resources, loss of biodiversity and climate change which threaten the environmental conditions in the Country.
The project aims at strengthening the environmental governance in Bosnia and Herzegovina by creating the conditions for Environmental CSOs and general public to effectively participate in the decision-making processes related to Environmental Impact Assessments (EIA)/ Strategic Environmental Assessments (SEA) procedures. To that, the intervention aims to influence the key reforms for further transposition and implementation of the EU Environmental Acquis. Civil society participation in decision-making processes is critical to strengthening participatory democracies, increasing ownership over decisions that affect a society’s future and assisting the achievement of sustainable development.
The intervention’s total budget is 15 000 000 SEK, however the total requested support amounts to 14 million SEK. The other 1 million SEK will be used by the Embassy/Sida for mid-term review and the final evaluation of the contribution.

The intervention aims at strengthening and specializing environmental civil society in BIH , enabling them to effectively participate in the policy and decision-making processes and thus contribute to the key reforms and further transposition and implementation of the EU Environmental Acquis in the country. In addition, the proposed intervention will support implementation of the Implementation of Sustainable Development Goals. The project is closely related to environment ( Environmental Impact Assessments (EIA)/ Strategic Environmental Assessments (SEA)), waste management and sustainable development. As such, it contributes to several sustainable development goals, primarily focusing on Goal 3, 11, 13, 15 and 16.

description.narrative: Based on the original Agreement the project was supposed to be implemented in the period between December 1, 2017 – December 31, 2020. Unfortunately, due to managerial crises and financial problems in REC HQ in Hungary, Sida had decided to terminate the implementation of the program on September 27, 2018. Reasons for termination were not related neither to REC Bosnia and Herzegovina nor to the implementation of the ELAN program. The Termination affected the program implementation in the 1st phase (reference to several activities interrupted or not initiated), as well as the overall budget. Shortly upon issuing termination letter embassy received request from Ministry of environment in Republika Srpska to enable completion of Waste management Plan for RS (component 6). Embassy has approved this request and subsequently has approved two 6-months extensions to REC BIH, Until November 2019, in order to enable completion of this component. The implementation period was 23 months, December 01, 2017 – October. 31, 2019. During the project implementation, yearly progress report has been submitted in due time. Communication with the project was fruitful and constructive. The lines bellow summarize the results and achievements during the implementation process, focusing in main activities and challenges:Project communication strategy has been developed and available. Project had been constantly promoted through different communication channels. Some promotion materials have been produced too.In-depth assessment of the nature and status of the environmental civil society organizations in BiH has been performed and Register / Directory of Enviro CSOs created.Capacity development of selected CSOs started with some OVT trainings, however it had to be stopped due to termination of contribution.First Call for proposals for grants had been developed launched. Unfortunately this activity had been also suspended though some 36 applications have been received.Checklists for EIA and SEA have been developed during reporting period, and could be used in future by CSOs but also by private companies.First Module Training on the purpose of SEAs and EIAs, EIA and SEA Directives and importance of public participation in the decision-making processes has been completed.A comprehensive stakeholder analysis of media institutions has been done and Environmental Media Database is created. First Media Training took place in Sarajevo. Unfortunately second training has not been implemented due to agreement termination.The “Waste Management Plan for Entity Republic of Srpska” and Strategic Environmental Assessment (SEA) for Waste Management Plan are successfully accomplished and submitted for adoption by Government of RS. This project component has been implemented with significant delays, mainly due to the slowness of the Ministry in processing and submitting information, therefore the project had to beextended twice more (until June 30th 2019 and last until November 30th 2019).Conclusions:The implementation of the program started on time and is done according to the approved revised plan of activities.CSOs have been quite active in participating in the program and the activities implemented are contributing to the program objectives.Due to reasons related neither to REC Bosnia and Herzegovina nor to the implementation of the ELAN program (than because critical governance and financial issues in REC HQ in Hungary), Sida decided to terminate the implementation of the program on September 27, 2018.Subsequently, Sida has approved Phasing-out Plan and Budget on October 12, 2018.Two additional extensions have been approved to enable full finalization of WM plan and related SEA (June 30th 2019 and last until November 30th 2019).REC BiH repaid to Sida 350.000 EUR on November 1st 2018, and 1,304.86 EUR should be repaid prior to the project closure.
